text_a: The fish ate the worm. It was hungry.
text_b: The fish was hungry.

text_a: I used an old rag to clean the knife, and then I put it in the drawer.
text_b: I put the knife in the drawer.

text_a: Sam Goodman's biography of the Spartan general Xenophanes conveys a vivid sense of the difficulties he faced in his research.
text_b: Sam Goodman's biography of the Spartan general Xenophanes conveys a vivid sense of the difficulties Xenophanes faced in his research.

text_a: Tom gave Ralph a lift to school so he wouldn't have to walk.
text_b: Ralph wouldn't have to walk.

text_a: The sack of potatoes had been placed above the bag of flour, so it had to be moved first.
text_b: The bag of flour had to be moved first.

text_a: John hired Bill to take care of him.
text_b: John hired Bill to take care of Bill.

text_a: The fish ate the worm. It was tasty.
text_b: The fish was tasty.

text_a: The painting in Mark's living room shows an oak tree. It is to the right of the bookcase.
text_b: The oak tree is to the right of the bookcase.

text_a: My meeting started at 4:00 and I needed to catch the train at 4:30, so there wasn't much time. Luckily, it was short, so it worked out.
text_b: The meeting was short, so it worked out.

text_a: Tom gave Ralph a lift to school so he wouldn't have to drive alone.
text_b: Tom wouldn't have to drive alone.

text_a: Anne gave birth to a daughter last month. She is a very charming baby.
text_b: Anne's daughter is a very charming baby.

text_a: Papa looked down at the children's faces, so puzzled and sad now. It was bad enough that they had to be denied so many things because he couldn't afford them.
text_b: It was bad enough that the children had to be denied so many things because he couldn't afford them.

text_a: It is not easy to space buttonholes exactly the same distance apart, and it is very difficult to cut them precisely the right size. The tiniest slip of the scissors will make the hole too large, and even one thread uncut will leave it too small.
text_b: Even one thread uncut will leave the right size too small.

text_a: Joe paid the detective after he delivered the final report on the case.
text_b: The detective delivered the final report on the case.

text_a: John was doing research in the library when he heard a man humming and whistling. He was very annoyed.
text_b: The man was very annoyed.

text_a: Mr. Moncrieff visited Chester's luxurious New York apartment, thinking that it belonged to his son Edward. The result was that Mr. Moncrieff has decided to cancel Edward's allowance on the ground that he no longer requires his financial support.
text_b: Edward no longer requires his financial support.

text_a: This book introduced Shakespeare to Goethe; it was a major influence on his writing.
text_b: It was a major influence on Shakespeare's writing.

text_a: The table was piled high with food, and on the floor beside it there were crocks, baskets, and a five-quart pail of milk.
text_b: Beside the food there were crocks, baskets, and a five-quart pail of milk.

text_a: At the Loebner competition the judges couldn't figure out which respondents were the chatbots because they were so advanced.
text_b: The judges were so advanced.

text_a: Archaeologists have concluded that humans lived in Laputa 20,000 years ago. They hunted for deer on the river banks.
text_b: Archaeologists hunted for deer on the river banks.
